get.description: Check API health status and get version information. This endpoint does not require authentication.

Retrieve a paginated list of all documents in your organization.

Documents can be filtered and sorted. The response includes basic document information and metadata. Use the 'getDocument' endpoint to retrieve full document details including signers.

**Pagination:** Use 'page' and 'perPage' query parameters to control pagination.

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of items per page (default: 10, max: 100)

externalId.description: Your external reference ID for this document

expiresAt.description: Date and time when the document expires

status.description: Document status: DRAFT, SENDING, PENDING, COMPLETED, EXPIRED, CANCELLED, or IMPORTED

documentMeta.description: Document metadata including subject, message, signing order, etc.

subject.description: Email subject line when sending document

message.description: Custom message included in signing invitation

signingOrder.description: Signing order: PARALLEL (all signers can sign simultaneously) or SEQUENTIAL (signers must sign in order)

defaultSignatureType.description: Default signature type: DRAWING, SMS_DRAWING, BANKID, or MANUAL

distributionMethod.description: How to send the document: EMAIL, SMS, or NONE (use signing URLs directly)

forceReadFullDocument.description: Whether signers must read the entire document before signing

showChatToSigners.description: Whether to show document chat to signers

preferredLanguage.description: Preferred language for the signing interface: sv (Swedish), en (English), no (Norwegian), da (Danish), or fi (Finnish)

value.description: Monetary value of the document (for contracts)

createdAt.description: Date and time when the document was created

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the document was last updated

completedAt.description: Date and time when all signers completed signing

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong
Error message describing what went wrong

externalId.description: Your external reference ID for tracking this document

type.description: Document type: SIGNABLE (default), ACCEPTABLE, or ARCHIVE_IMPORTED

templateId.description: Template ID to create document from. Template fields will be copied to the document.

responsibleUserId.description: User ID of the person responsible for this document. Must be a member of your organization.

documentStyle.description: Document styling configuration including orientation, padding, and background color

paddingEnabled.description: Whether to show padding around document content. When false, content fills entire page edge-to-edge (default: true)

backgroundColor.description: Background color for the document in hex format (e.g., #ffffff for white, #000000 for black). Default: #ffffff

signers.description: Array of signers to add to the document during creation. Provide either contactId to reference existing contacts, or name and email to manually specify signer details.

role.description: Signer role: SIGNER, ORGANIZER, REVIEWER, or ACCEPTOR

signingOrder.description: Order for sequential signing (1, 2, 3, etc.). Ignored for parallel signing.

documentId.description: Unique identifier for the created document

externalId.description: Your external reference ID

signingUrl.description: Complete signing URL for this signer

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific document including all signers, tags, and custom field values.

The response includes:
- Document metadata (subject, message, signing order, etc.)
- All document signers with their status
- Applied tags
- Custom field values
- Document timestamps (created, updated, completed, archived)

patch.description:
Update document properties. Only DRAFT documents can have all fields updated. Sent documents have restrictions.

**Updatable Fields:**
- `name` - Document title
- `externalId` - Your external reference ID
- `expiresAt` - Document expiration date
- `responsibleUserId` - User ID of responsible team member (must be in your organization)
- `documentMeta` - Metadata including subject, message, signing order, distribution method, signature type, etc.
- `customFields` - Custom field values

**Note:** Some fields like signing order cannot be modified after the document is sent.

**Note:** Deleted documents are not included in list responses but can be retrieved by ID if you have the document ID.

get.description:
Get a download URL for a document.

**Query Parameters:**
- `downloadOriginalDocument` (boolean): If true, downloads the original unsigned document. If false (default), downloads the signed/sealed version.

**Response:** Returns a pre-signed URL valid for 1 hour. The URL provides secure access to the document file.

**Status Requirements:**
- For signed documents: Document must be in COMPLETED status
- For original documents: Available for all document statuses

downloadUrl.description: Pre-signed URL for downloading the document (valid for 1 hour)

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong
Error message describing what went wrong

post.description:
Send a document to signers for signing. The document status will change from DRAFT to PENDING.

**Delivery Methods:**
- `EMAIL` - Send signing invitations via email
- `SMS` - Send signing links via SMS (requires phone numbers)
- `NONE` - Don't send notifications (use signing URLs directly)

**Custom Message:** Optional custom message included in the invitation.

**Signature Type:** The signature type is determined by the document's `documentMeta.defaultSignatureType` setting. Set this via the update document endpoint before sending:
- `DRAWING` - Free-hand signature drawing (SES - Simple Electronic Signature)
- `BANKID` - Swedish BankID electronic signature (AES - Advanced Electronic Signature)
- `MANUAL` - Manual signature (for in-person signing)

**Prerequisites:** Document must have at least one signer and a signature type configured before sending.

deliveryMethod.description: How to send the document: EMAIL, SMS, or NONE

customMessage.description: Optional custom message to include in the signing invitation

externalId.description: Your external reference ID for this document

expiresAt.description: Date and time when the document expires

updatedAt.description: Date and time when the document was last updated

post.description:
Add a signer/participant to a document. The signer must reference an existing contact.

**Signer Roles:**
- `SIGNER` - Must sign the document
- `ORGANIZER` - Document organizer (no signature required)
- `REVIEWER` - Reviews document (no signature required)
- `ACCEPTOR` - Accepts terms (for acceptance documents)

**Signing Order:** For SEQUENTIAL signing, specify the order (1, 2, 3...). For PARALLEL signing, order is ignored.

**Response:** Returns the created signer with a unique signing URL and token.

contactId.description: ID of the contact to add as a signer

signingOrder.description: Signing order for sequential signing (ignored for parallel)

documentId.description: Document ID this signer belongs to

externalId.description: Your external reference ID for this signer

ssn.description: Swedish personal number (personnummer) - required for BankID signing

role.description: Signer role: SIGNER, ORGANIZER, REVIEWER, or ACCEPTOR

signedAt.description: Date and time when the signer signed (null if not signed)

signingStatus.description: Signing status: NOT_SIGNED, SIGNED, or REJECTED

signingUrl.description: Complete signing URL for this signer

get.description:
Retrieve all signers for a document WITHOUT signing URLs.

This endpoint returns signer information for display purposes. Signing URLs are not included for security reasons.

To get a signer's signing URL (which creates an audit log entry), use the GET /documents/:id/signers/:signerId endpoint.

patch.description:
Update signer information. Most fields can only be updated before the document is sent.

**Updatable Fields:**
- `name` - Signer's full name
- `email` - Signer's email address
- `phone` - Signer's phone number
- `companyName` - Company name
- `companyRole` - Role within company
- `companyOrgNumber` - Company organization number
- `companyId` - Link to existing company
- `ssn` - Swedish personal number (for BankID)
- `role` - Signer role (SIGNER, ORGANIZER, REVIEWER, ACCEPTOR)
- `signingOrder` - Order for sequential signing

**Restrictions:** Cannot update after signer has signed the document.

get.description:
Retrieve a specific signer including their signing URL.

**Security Note:** This endpoint creates an audit log entry each time a signing URL is accessed. Use this endpoint when you need the signing URL to share with the signer.

**Response includes:**
- Signer details (name, email, phone, company info)
- Signing status (NOT_SIGNED, SIGNED, REJECTED)
- Read status (NOT_OPENED, OPENED, READ)
- Complete signing URL with token

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all contacts in your organization.

Contacts are individuals that can be added as signers to documents. Each contact can optionally be associated with a company.

**Pagination:** Use 'page' and 'perPage' query parameters.

post.description:
Create a new contact in your organization.

**Required Fields:**
- `firstName` - Contact's first name
- `lastName` - Contact's last name

**Optional Fields:**
- `email` - Email address
- `phone` - Phone number (for SMS notifications)
- `ssn` - Swedish personal number (for BankID)
- `externalId` - Your external reference ID for tracking
- `companyId` - Associate with existing company
- `companyRole` - Role within the company

get.description:
Search for contacts by email, phone number, or external ID.

**Query Parameters (at least one required):**
- `email` - Search by exact email address match
- `phone` - Search by exact phone number match
- `externalId` - Search by exact external ID match

**Response:** Returns an array of matching contacts. Empty array if no matches found.

**Note:** All searches are exact matches and scoped to your organization.

post.description:
Add a field/section to a document. Can create single field or multiple fields at once.

**Field Types:**
- `TEXT` - Rich text content section (Tiptap editor format)
- `HTML` - Raw HTML content with custom styling (API-only, sanitized for security)
- `FORM` - Form with input fields for signers
- `PDF` - PDF file section
- `PRODUCT_TABLE` - Product/service table with pricing

**Field Position:** Determines the order fields appear in the document (0-based index).

**Field Metadata:** Each field type has specific metadata requirements. See schema documentation for details.

**HTML Field Security:** HTML fields accept raw HTML but are automatically sanitized server-side to allow only safe formatting tags (p, div, span, headings, lists, tables, images) and basic CSS styling. Links, script tags, and dangerous attributes are stripped. Images support HTTP/HTTPS URLs and data URIs for inline images.

Custom fields allow you to add additional structured data to documents or contacts.

**Required Fields:**
- `name` - Field name
- `type` - DOCUMENT or CONTACT
- `inputType` - Input type (TEXT, NUMBER, DATE, CHECKBOX, SELECT, TEXTAREA)

**Optional Fields:**
- `defaultValue` - Default value for the field
- `required` - Whether field is required (default: false)
- `options` - For SELECT type, comma-separated options

**Warning:** This will remove all values associated with this field from all documents/contacts.

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of all sajn ID identity verifications in your organization.

sajn ID enables secure identity verification using Swedish BankID, either with SSN validation or name-based verification.

**Pagination:** Use 'page' and 'perPage' query parameters.

**Filtering:**
- `status` - Filter by verification status (can specify multiple)
- `dateFrom` - Filter by creation date from
- `dateTo` - Filter by creation date to

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of items per page (default: 10, max: 100)

items.description:
sajn ID Status:
- CREATED: Verification created but not sent
- SENT: Verification sent to recipient
- OPENED: Recipient opened verification link
- VERIFIED: Identity successfully verified
- FAILED: Verification failed
- EXPIRED: Verification link expired
- CANCELED: Verification was canceled

parameters.name: dateFrom
parameters.description: Filter by creation date from (ISO date string)

parameters.name: dateTo
parameters.description: Filter by creation date to (ISO date string)

fullName.description: Full name of person being verified

failureReason.description: Reason for failure (if status is FAILED)

createdAt.description: When the verification was created

updatedAt.description: When the verification was last updated

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong

post.description:
Create a new identity verification request. Optionally send it immediately to the recipient.

**Required Fields:**
- `fullName` - Full name of person to verify (required)
- `channel` - Delivery channel: EMAIL or SMS (required)
- Channel-specific: `email` (for EMAIL) or `phone` (for SMS)

**Optional Fields:**
- `ssn` - Swedish personal number for SSN-based verification (without SSN, name-based verification is used)
- `reference` - External reference ID for tracking
- `note` - Internal note about this verification
- `contactId` - Link to existing contact
- `locale` - Message locale (default: sv-SE)

**Verification Methods:**
- **SSN-based**: When `ssn` is provided, BankID verification validates both identity and SSN match
- **Name-based**: Without `ssn`, BankID verifies identity and name match

**Response:** Returns verification details including token and verification URL (only on creation, never exposed later).

**Billing:** Creating a sajn ID verification counts toward your monthly sajn ID quota and is billed accordingly.
post.summary: Create a new sajn ID verification

fullName.description: Full name of the person to verify (required)

get.description:
Retrieve detailed information about a specific sajn ID verification including status, audit logs, and verification data.

The response includes:
- Verification status and timestamps
- Contact information (email/phone based on channel)
- Linked contact details (if applicable)
- Complete audit log of all verification events
- Verification data (e.g., BankID response for verified identities)

**Note:** Sensitive information like SSN is encrypted and not returned in the API response.

post.description:
Create a file record and get a presigned URL for uploading.

**Upload Flow:**
1. Call this endpoint with file details to create a file record and get presigned URL
2. Upload your file directly to the presigned URL using a PUT request
3. The file is ready to use once uploaded

**File Requirements:**
- Maximum size: 100 MB
- Allowed types: PDF, DOC, DOCX, XLS, XLSX, PPT, PPTX, MP4, MOV, AVI, WEBM, JPG, PNG, GIF, WEBP, SVG

**Visibility:**
- `PRIVATE` (default): Files require signed URLs for access (60 min expiry)
- `PUBLIC`: Files are accessible via direct CloudFront URL

**Response Fields:**
- `fileId` - Unique identifier for the created file
- `url` - Presigned URL for direct upload to S3 (expires in 1 hour)
- `key` - S3 key for the file

**Example Upload:**
```
// 1. Get presigned URL
POST /api/v1/files/presigned-url
{ "fileName": "document.pdf", "mimeType": "application/pdf", "visibility": "PRIVATE", "size": 1024000 }

// 2. Upload file directly to S3
PUT <presigned-url>
Content-Type: application/pdf
<file-content>
```
post.summary: Create file and get presigned upload URL

schema.description: Request for creating a file and getting presigned upload URL

fileName.description: Name of the file to upload

visibility.description: File visibility: PRIVATE (requires signed URL) or PUBLIC (direct access)

checksumSHA256.description: Base64-encoded SHA-256 checksum of the file. Calculate this client-side and include in x-amz-checksum-sha256 header when uploading.

200.description: Presigned upload URL response with file ID

schema.description: Presigned upload URL response with file ID

url.description: Presigned URL for uploading the file (valid for 1 hour)

key.description: S3 key for the uploaded file

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong
Error message describing what went wrong

get.description:
Retrieve file information and access URL.

**URL Generation:**
- For `PRIVATE` files: Returns a fresh signed URL (valid for 60 minutes)
- For `PUBLIC` files: Returns the permanent CloudFront URL

**Response includes:**
- File metadata (filename, size, MIME type)
- Visibility setting
- Access URL
- Upload information

url.description: URL to access the file (signed URL for private, direct URL for public)

createdAt.description: Date and time when file was uploaded

updatedAt.description: Date and time when file was last updated

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong
Error message describing what went wrong

delete.description:
Delete a file from storage and database.

**Warning:** This operation is irreversible. The file will be permanently deleted from both S3 and the database.

message.description: Error message describing what went wrong
Error message describing what went wrong

get.description:
Retrieve a paginated list of files in your organization.

**Pagination:** Use 'page' and 'perPage' query parameters.

**Filtering:** Optionally filter by visibility (PRIVATE or PUBLIC).

**Response:**
- Files are sorted by creation date (newest first)
- Use the 'getFile' endpoint to retrieve file access URLs

parameters.name: perPage
parameters.description: Number of items per page (default: 10, max: 100)

updatedAt.description: Date and time when file was last updated

info.title: sajn API
info.description:
# sajn Digital Signing API

Welcome to the sajn API documentation. This RESTful API allows you to integrate digital document signing capabilities into your applications.

## Overview

sajn is a Swedish digital document signing platform that enables you to:
- Create and manage digital documents
- Add signers and participants to documents
- Send documents for signing via email or SMS
- Track document status and signatures
- Manage contacts and companies
- Organize documents with tags and custom fields
- Perform identity verification with sajn ID (BankID integration)

## Authentication

All API requests require authentication using an API key. Include your API key in the Authorization header:

```
Authorization: Bearer YOUR_API_KEY
```

You can generate API keys from your organization settings in the sajn dashboard.

## Rate Limiting

API requests are rate limited to ensure service stability:
- 100 requests per minute per API key
- 1000 requests per hour per API key

Rate limit headers are included in all responses.

## Pagination

List endpoints support pagination with the following query parameters:
- `page` - Page number (default: 1)
- `perPage` - Items per page (default: 10, max: 100)

## Webhooks

Configure webhooks to receive real-time notifications about document events:
- `DOCUMENT_CREATED` - When a document is created
- `DOCUMENT_SENT` - When a document is sent for signing
- `DOCUMENT_OPENED` - When a signer opens a document
- `DOCUMENT_SIGNED` - When a signer signs a document
- `DOCUMENT_COMPLETED` - When all signers have signed
- `DOCUMENT_REJECTED` - When a signer rejects a document

## Error Handling

The API uses standard HTTP status codes and returns error details in JSON format:

```json
{
  "message": "Error description"
}
```

Common status codes:
- 200: Success
- 400: Bad Request - Invalid parameters
- 401: Unauthorized - Invalid or missing API key
- 404: Not Found - Resource doesn't exist
- 409: Conflict - Resource already exists
- 500: Internal Server Error

## Support

For API support, documentation, or questions:
- Email: support@sajn.se
- Documentation: https://docs.sajn.se
- Status: https://status.sajn.se
